main event: A sighting of a possible unconventional aircraft was reported from Naval Air Station, Lakehurst, New Jersey on June 27, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as a white light flashing on and off, believed to be at a high altitude., The observers used binoculars to view the object., The sighting lasted approximately 45 seconds., The object was seen circling at an altitude of 5,000 feet., Weather conditions were clear, with visibility over fifteen miles.
witness description: Two observers assigned to duty in the tower for the past twenty-one months, considered reliable, sincere, and intelligent.
